thread.title: Jeep recalling Cherokees for wiper defect
thread.title_full: Jeep recalling Cherokees for wiper defect

title: Jeep recalling Cherokees for wiper defect
text:
Published: Tue, September 1, 2015 @ 12:00 a.m. 
Associated Press 
DETROIT 
Fiat Chrysler is recalling 206,668 Jeep Cherokee SUVs because the windshield wipers can stop working unexpectedly. 
Cherokees from the 2014 model-year are affected. There are 158,671 in the U.S., 18,366 in Canada and 3,582 in Mexico. The rest were sold outside North America. 
Fiat Chrysler says static buildup may occur if the wipers are used when it’s dry. Static buildup can affect the module that powers the wipers and potentially disable them. 
The company says it’s not aware of any accidents or injuries related to the issue. 
Customers will be notified, and dealers will repair the vehicles for free. Other stories of interest
